column4: 3tsp hot madras curry powder, 1.5tsp coriander, 1tsp cumin, 1.5tsp paprika, 1tsp turmeric (maybe +1/2), 1tsp mild curry powder, 1/4tsp garam masala, 2tsp cayenne (-1/2 for less spicy), 1/4tsp black pepper, 1tsp kasoor methi (dried fenugreek leaves can omit if you cant find), 1.5tsp kosher salt, 1/2tsp cinnamon, 4-6tbsp oil, 1 jumbo yellow Onion, 4-5 cloves garlic (don't be afraid), 2-3tbsp minced fresh ginger (Measure with you heart and don't be afraid), 3-4tbsp tomato paste (plus more as needed add with water), 10oz unsweetened coconut milk, 2lb chicken (but not much more), 1/2 lemon squeezed (maybe more check for flavor. This is the most important ingredient), naan, rice
column5: (1) Mix Spices; Dilute tomato paste with water; mix onion, ginger and garlic in food processor. (2) Heat pan/pot (ideally non-stick) to medium, add 3-4Tbsp oil, and add onion-ginger-garlic mix, let cook for ~20 minutes (You want it to almost caramelize, the mixture will turn green and then blue). (3) Take off the heat and add the spice mix and stir constantly for 30 seconds. (4) Turn heat to medium high and add diluted tomato mix and cook for a few minutes. (5) Turn heat to low and add coconut milk and lemon and let simmer. (6) Cook chicken with remaining oil, so that almost no pink is showing and then add curry into pan and finish cooking. To save time start this step when onions are almost done

column4: 3tsp hot madras curry powder, 1.5tsp coriander, 1tsp cumin, 1.5tsp paprika, 1tsp turmeric (maybe +1/2), 1tsp mild curry powder, 1/4tsp garam masala, 2tsp cayenne (-1/2 for less spicy), 1/4tsp black pepper, 1tsp kasoor methi (dried fenugreek leaves can omit if you cant find), 1.5tsp kosher salt, 1/2tsp cinnamon, 4-6tbsp oil, 1 jumbo yellow Onion, 4-5 cloves garlic (don't be afraid), 2-3tbsp minced fresh ginger (Measure with you heart and don't be afraid), 3-4tbsp tomato paste (plus more as needed add with water), 10oz unsweetened coconut milk, 2 Potatoes, 1 Head Broccoli, 1 handfull spinich, 1/2 lemon squeezed (maybe more check for flavor. This is the most important ingredient), naan, rice
column5: (1) Mix Spices; Dilute tomato paste with water; mix onion, ginger and garlic in food processor. (2) Heat pan/pot (ideally non-stick) to medium, add 3-4Tbsp oil, and add onion-ginger-garlic mix, let cook for ~20 minutes (You want it to almost caramelize, the mixture will turn green and then blue). (3) Take off the heat and add the spice mix and stir constantly for 30 seconds. (4) Turn heat to medium high and add diluted tomato mix and cook for a few minutes. (5) Add chopped Potatos and Broccoli and cook for ??, maybe just do this after step 6. im really not sure  (6) Turn heat to low and add coconut milk and lemon and let simmer for 15-20 minutes. (7) add spinich and simmer for 2-3 minutes

column4: 2tbsp oil, 1 large yellow onion, 3-4 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp minced fresh ginger, 1.5tsp salt, 1.5tsp coriander, 1.5tsp garam masala, 1tsp turmeric, 1tsp cumin, 1/2tsp cardamom, 1.5tsp cayenne pepper, 1tbsp tomato paste, 1/2cup water, 8oz baby spinach, 1.5-2lb chicken, 1/4cup plain greek yogurt
column5: (1) Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat (if you plan to double the recipe, definitely use a pot instead of a skillet so you have room for all the spinach!). Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and saute until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes, stirring regularly, and lowering heat to medium-low if it starts to brown too quickly. (2) Over medium heat, add the salt (SEE NOTES), coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cumin, cardamom, and chili powder, and stir on medium-low heat until fragrant, about 30 seconds or so. Dissolve the tomato paste in the water by stirring vigorously together in a measuring cup or bowl. Then stir into the spices in the pan, creating a thick spiced sauce, about 1 minute. (3) Add the spinach and gently stir to combine, as the skillet will be very full. Cover and raise the heat to medium-high, allowing the spinach to start to wilt. Occasionally remove the lid, stir, and then cover again until most the spinach has begun to wilt, about 3 to 5 minutes (can depend on the size of your spinach leaves). Remove the lid and finish stirring the spinach until it is completely wilted but still bright green, another minute. (4) Transfer spinach mixture to a blender and puree until relatively smooth but still a bit chunky (you don't want it to be super smooth, a bit of texture is good). Taste and adjust salt and spice if necessary. (5) Meanwhile, wipe the skillet clean with a paper towel, return it to medium-high heat, and add 1 tablespoon of oil. When the oil is hot, add the cubed chicken pieces, sprinkle salt over the top to season, and cook until almost completely cooked through, about 5 to 7 minutes. Pour the spinach mixture back over the chicken, using a rubber spatula to get every last bit out of the blender, and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld and the chicken to finish cooking. Stir in the yogurt, and serve immediately with basmati rice and/or naan.

column4: 2tbsp oil, 1 large yellow onion, 3-4 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp minced fresh ginger, 1.5tsp salt, 1.5tsp coriander, 1.5tsp garam masala, 1tsp turmeric, 1tsp cumin, 1/2tsp cardamom, 1.5tsp cayenne pepper, 1tbsp tomato paste, 1/2cup water, 8oz baby spinach, 1.5lb Paneer, 1/4cup plain greek yogurt
column5: (1) Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat (if you plan to double the recipe, definitely use a pot instead of a skillet so you have room for all the spinach!). Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and saute until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes(or more, really let the onion release their flavor), stirring regularly, and lowering heat to medium-low if it starts to brown too quickly. (2) Cut paneer into thin triangle and fry in oil/ghee for no more then 2 minutes. Then soak in warm water for 15 minutes. (2) Over medium heat, add the salt (SEE NOTES), coriander, garam masala, turmeric, cumin, cardamom, and chili powder, and stir on medium-low heat until fragrant, about 30 seconds or so. Dissolve the tomato paste in the water by stirring vigorously together in a measuring cup or bowl(or blend a satee a real tomato, and used 3:1 table spoon). Then stir into the spices in the pan, creating a thick spiced sauce, about 1 minute. (3) Add the spinach and gently stir to combine, as the skillet will be very full. Cover and raise the heat to medium-high, allowing the spinach to start to wilt. Occasionally remove the lid, stir, and then cover again until most the spinach has begun to wilt, about 3 to 5 minutes (can depend on the size of your spinach leaves). Remove the lid and finish stirring the spinach until it is completely wilted but still bright green, another minute. (4) Transfer spinach mixture to a blender and puree until relatively smooth but still a bit chunky (you don't want it to be super smooth, a bit of texture is good). Taste and adjust salt and spice if necessary. (5) Pour the spinach mixture back over in the pain, using a rubber spatula to get every last bit out of the blender, and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Stir in the yogurt, add the paneer, and serve immediately with basmati rice and/or naan.

column4: 390g bread flour, 1 packet active dry yeast, 2tsp sea salt, 1/4cup olive oil, 1cup warm water, 1 mozzarella package (4 slices of fresh mozz per pizza), feta, parmesan, toppings of choice
column5: (1) Mix dough ingredients, knead, and let rise for ideally 18hrs but any amount is also fine. (2) Flatten dough and add toppings as desired. (3) cook pizza at 500 degree for 7 minutes.

column4: pasta, extra sharp cheddar, parmesan, cream cheese (maybe brie), 1.5tbsp butter per serving, 1.5tbsp ap flour per serving, oat milk paprika;pesto;buffalo chicken sauce, salt, pepper
column5: (1) Under cook pasta by 1 minute. (2) For sauce melt butter in pot at medium low heat, once melted stir in flour and let sit for 1.5 minute stirring occasionally. (3) slowly add milk until mixture has consistency of paint. (4) add cheese and melt. (5) once fully melted add in pasta and any optional ingredients.

column4: Broccoli head, garlic, onion powder, olive oil, salt pepper
column5: (1) Cut broccoli head into small pieces and mix with oil and spices as desired. (2) Bake at 450 degree for 25 minutes

column4: 3 Chicken breasts, cheddar cheese, monterey jack, 2tbsp oil per quesadilla, 2 garlic cloves, 1tbsp Cumin, 1tsp Paprika, 1tsp oregano, 1tsp cayenne, salt, pepper Flour tortillas
column5: (1) Butterfly chicken and smash/flatten, and then marinate for 30 minutes, with 1 tbsp of oil, spices, crushed garlic cloves and optionally lemon and a small amount of sugar. (2) grate equal parts cheddar and  monterey jack.  (3) cook chicken, then cut into pieces/strips. (4) make quesadilla and cook at medium with a good amount of oil

column4: 3-4 Handfuls of chips, Cheddar Cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, 1 package of impossible spicy sausage, 2 roma tomatoes, 1/2 onion or onion powder, 2 cloves garlic or garlic powder, 1-2 jalapenos, black beans, 1 avocado, lemon, chili powder
column5: (1) Lightly cook impossible meat, chop tomatoes, onions, jalapenos, and grate cheese. (2) on an oven sheet put chips, small layer of cheese, then add beans and meat, onions, garlic, jalapenos and tomatoes, and finally top with cheese. (3) bake at 350-400 for 15 minutes and then broil for 5. (4) mash avocado, add lemon, chili powder, garlic and onions and serve on top of nachos

column4: Pasta, 1-2tbsp unsalted butter, heavy whipping cream, parmesan, red sauce, 1tbsp tomato paste, 1/2 tube of Impossible Sausage
column5: (1) Under cook pasta by 1 minute. Cook Impossible Sausage (2) strain pasta and then melt butter in pasta, add heavy whipping cream and parmesan. (3) add red sauce and tomato paste and Impossible Sausage

column4: Pasta, 2tsp olive oil, 200g bacon or pancetta, 1 onion, 50g butter, 40g flour, 600ml milk, brie (small wheel), Jalapenos (optional)
column5: (1) Preheat oven to 425 degrees. (2) Cut bacon into small pieces and finely chop the onion. Cook pasta until al dente. Meanwhile, fry bacon and onion in a saucepan until mostly cooked (everything will be finished in the oven).(3) Make a roux by first adding butter to a pan. Then mix in flour, cook for 30 seconds and gradually add in milk. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.(4) Cut the rind of the brie and cut brie into small cubes. Add 2/3 to the roux and stir until combined. Season with salt and pepper.(5) Add the pasta and brie sauce to a baking pan. Mix in bacon and jalapenos and add remaining brie on top. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.

column4: 2 chicken breasts, olive oil, 1large lemon, bone broth, 1/2 onion, garlic, rosemary, 1/4cup heavy cream (about), butter, pasta/rice/potatoes for serving (optional)
column5: (1) Pound chicken breast to equal thickness (if making a quick dinner, cut into similar size pieces). (2) In a skillet, heat oil to medium-high heat and add chicken. Flip occasionally and remove when 75% cooked. (3) Turn skillet down and add onion. Sweat for a few minutes. (4) Zest lemon, and add zest to the skillet as well as the lemon juice. Add butter and scrape up browned bits from pan. (5) Add heavy cream and a little bone broth. Add garlic and rosemary (measure with your heart). (6) Add lemon slices and simmer sauce for 8-10 minutes or until reduced and saucy. (7) Add chicken back to the pan and finish cooking.

column4: Chicken or veggies, 1-2tbps green curry paste, 1 onion, 1 can coconut milk, tumeric, ginger, rice, green onions, lime, cilantro
column5: (1) Start rice and season chicken with tumeric, ginger, garlic, salt and pepper. (2)In a pan, add the chicken and diced onion (if making veggie version add chopped veggies of choice). Cook unitl 75% done. (3) Remove chicken and place aside. In the same pan, add more garlic, coconut milk and green curry powder. Combine. To taste, add more tumeric and ginger. Let simmer for 3-5 minutes. (4) Return chicken to pan and continue simmering until the chicken is done cooking. (5) Serve over rice and top with lime juice, chopped green onions, and cilantro.
